item.description: Why do you write it correctly in the subject, but wrong in the comment itself?

item.title: Anonymous (not verified): Comment 3
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous (not verified)
item.description:
This is actually a step backwards, the install is reported as successful but Vidalia doesn't appear in the Applications folder.

This is a freshly installed OS X 10.5.7 from DVD, no patches.

item.title: Anonymous (not verified): Comment 4
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous (not verified)
item.description: By the way, I did this install in a standard user account, and it didn't prompt for an administrator's username/password. I'll try it under an admin account and report the results here.

item.title: phobos: Comment 6
item.dcterms:creator: phobos
item.description: This is fixed in the latest bundles that include Vidalia 0.1.15. There's an issue when torbutton tries to get automatically installed into Firefox. If you don't have admin permissions, it failed, and the Apple installer said the whole install failed.

item.title: Anonymous (not verified): Comment 7
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous (not verified)
item.description:
The country flags in the left column (after selecting "View the Network" from the Vidalia Control Panel) are missing in the new Vidalia/Firefox bundle. Is this a new security measure, or a fault? The IPs would tell the country, anyway, so why not the flags?

Can I fix this, or is this intentional by Tor?

What should I do?

Thank you very much.

item.title: phobos: Comment 8
item.dcterms:creator: phobos
item.description: Leave tor running, it will connect to the vidalia geoip server and fill in the relays.

item.title: Anonymous (not verified): Comment 9
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous (not verified)
item.description:
Thank you for your reply.

No matter how long I have Tor running, the country flags of the computers on the network do not fill in (the window brought up by the "View the network" option on the Vidalia Control Panel).

Do you have any other suggestions? All I have is a series of question marks in place of the flags, and it's driving me a little nuts.

Thank you very much.

item.title: himm (not verified): Comment 10
item.dcterms:creator: himm (not verified)
item.description: Thank you, you answered the question I have been searching for which was whether or not to place keywords when blog commenting. mirc . chat . cinsel sohbet. cinsellik sohbet . http://www.hayda.net/

item.title: Anonymous: Comment 11
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous
item.description: I have a similar question as to why Vidalia doesn't show all IP location in the list? It only show the question mark for some, been like this for weeks now. Does Tor, Vidalia or the bundle has a dedicated discussion forum so I can fix my geoip issues?
